intro: Heterophlebium, commonly known as the false orchid, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Orchidaceae. It is characterized by its unique floral structure, which includes a single, showy sepal that resembles an orchid petal. The plants are typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, often growing in shaded, moist environments. Heterophlebium species are known for their small, delicate flowers and their ability to thrive in low-light conditions. Botanically, they are distinguished by their specialized leaf arrangements and reproductive structures.
